DataElement.preferredName: Patient Clinical Study Protocol Not Enrolled Reason
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Term to explain why a patient was not enrolled in a clinical trial protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An explanation of the reason a person did not enroll for a protocol.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:No value exists.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.

Property.preferredDefinition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Clinical Study Protocol Not Enrolled Reason
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An action plan for a clinical trial.  The plan states what the study will do, how, and why.  It explains how many people will be in it, who is eligible to participate, what study agents or other interventions they will be given, what tests they will receive and how often, and what information will be gathered._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._Enrollment; to insert, register, or enter in a list, catalog, or roll. (Merriam-Webster Online)_An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

PermissibleValues.value: Patient did not meet trial eligibility criteria
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Negation Fulfill Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Negation Fulfill Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: Satisfy the requirements or expectations of.: Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Satisfy the requirements or expectations of.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

PermissibleValues.value: Patient was eligible but MD declined to offer participation

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A position, opinion or judgment reached after consideration by a physician with reference to subject.

Concepts.definition: A position, opinion or judgment reached after consideration by a physician with reference to subject.

PermissibleValues.value: Patient was eligible but started treatment prior to completion of screening

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of study protocol designed to evaluate intervention(s) for disease treatment.: Earlier in time or order.: A systematic examination or assessment.: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

Concepts.definition: A type of study protocol designed to evaluate intervention(s) for disease treatment.
To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

PermissibleValues.value: Patient was eligible but declined participation

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Clinical Study Protocol Negation Enrollment Reason
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An action plan for a clinical trial.  The plan states what the study will do, how, and why.  It explains how many people will be in it, who is eligible to participate, what study agents or other interventions they will be given, what tests they will receive and how often, and what information will be gathered.:An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:Enrollment; to insert, register, or enter in a list, catalog, or roll. (Merriam-Webster Online):An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: A formal document that describes a complete plan of research activity in the framework of a clinical study; specifically, the study objective(s), design, methodology, eligibility requests for prospective subjects and controls; intervention regimen(s), proposed methods of analysis of data; statistical considerations, and organization of the study. The protocol usually also provides the background and rationale for the study, but these could be represented in other protocol referenced documents.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ReferenceDocuments.name: If the patient did not enroll
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient did not enroll in the protocol, indicate the reason why
